performances.description: While the Hundred Year Hall CD is out of order the music on it is great...check this Lovelight out if you got the album
Solo is incredible. Every time Garcia starts to peak in his solo, the band is right there to add to the build up.
Barn burnin' show closer

performances.venue: Fillmore East New York City, NY

performances.description: After and epic NFA Pigpen unleashes into one of the best Raps of any Lovelight.  Crowd is howling in the matrix version!!!
Hard and to the point. Love the PIG!
I know Deadheads try to prove themselves by choosing more obscure versions, but the 'Live/Dead' version is EASILY in the Top 5 'Love Lights' ever.
the return of the "shine on me" from the 60's!  unique out of control pHilly vibe

performances.venue: Fillmore East New York City, NY
performances.description: and the little PIGGY screamed wee wee all the home!!!
Branford really makes this, well... SHINE

performances.venue: Fillmore East New York City, NY
performances.description: great for the crazy allman bros infused lineup. and the dude from fleetwood mac? who knew they were cool?
Thelma Theatre LA. Set 1 Lovelight!  Middle Jam is so slow and groovy. 29:00 long come on
Another great 1970 Lovelight, if you don’t know this show, spin it.  Very mellow island vibe, great Lovelight to close.
WOW, 46 mintes of primal Grateful Dead, this is fantastic a must listen Pigpen in control, Jerry ripping this is awesome stuff
Curious that no one would mention this classic version.

performances.venue: Fillmore East (Late Show) New York, NY
performances.description: stunning 27 minute pigpen love light, an amazing gem!
Lovelight > King Bee > Mannish Boy > Lovelight
Nice Pig action!!! There is a mini version of NFA sandwiched in between.
A burner

performances.venue: Seminole Indian Village West Hollywood, FL
performances.description: Commercially released, and for good reason. A legendary show

performances.venue: Monterey Performing Arts Center Monterey, CA
performances.description: Triple Lovelight sandwhich, need I say more?
Insane
Woodstock 45+ Min
Last ever with Pig.
Hornsby always makes Jerry play better. Here's the AUD I've been loving: https://archive.org/details/gd1991-06-14.sennME80.wklitz.94371.flac16
Janis Joplin on this one!! Pig and Janis are 2 peas in a pod!!! (literally) We're talking the summer of love here.  Does not get much better!!

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: Love Branford on LL.  Sax is perfect for this tune.  I think this one is better than 3/29/90!
Unbelievable Pig...classic rapping
Overdoing this date, I know, but this Lovelight deserves respect
Very surprised this one is not listed, 38 Mins, one of the longest.  Jerry slide solos, Peter Green wailing, and of course Pigpen at his peak.
Janis and Ron - simultaneously raunchy and adorable. At about 11 minutes, Jerry takes advantage of a lull in the patter to melt faces.
HEAVY! Out of control energy coming from the drums, vocals, guitars- everything!

performances.venue: Fillmore East (Late Show) New York City, NY
performances.description: Amazing show, deserves more recognition
Dark Star>St. Stephen>Eleven>Turn On Your Love Light.  One complete piece of music.
Lovelight > NFA > Lovelight;  Dave's Picks 6

performances.venue: Kings Beach Bowl Lake Tahoe, CA
performances.description: Short and sweet lovelight from Dicks Picks vol. 22
Pig goes off !

performances.venue: Seminole Indian Village West Hollywood, FL
performances.description: How this version is not on here??  This is a classic 30 minute 1969 Pig version...HARD HITTIN
A Lovelight on Valentine's Day? Pig and the band tear it up.
Pig was responsible for a whole lotta new babies after this one. Turns it over and gives the ladies some instruction to go out and get it. Nice.
hot 69 playing
Pig continues his quest to get everyone on the planet laid, goes 2 for 2 in the Grateful Dead Dating Game.

performances.venue: Alpine Valley Music Theatre East Troy, WI
performances.description: Such a great way to end alpine. They could have gone off at the end, but still a great rendition. Watch on video if you can
View From The Vault

performances.venue: Greek Theatre - University of California Berkeley, CA
performances.description: Not as long as 69 versions, but super hot...maybe more focused and better to some.
Everybody's ALL IN on this macho ruckus - the closing hollering and howling is for the ages. Peak powered tightly loose jams.
Go ahead and air drum the crap out of this one...
All the bells and whistles right here.. pleading jarring howling zonked out 69 action.

performances.venue: Gulfstream Park Race Track Hallandale, FL
performances.description: Do the boys always kill it in the state of Florida? Sure seems so...
Nice post Pigpen version...with borrowed instruments to boot
Lovelight > Caution jam > Lovelight. Booyah!!

performances.venue: Terminal Island Correctional Facility San Pedro, CA
performances.description: Super hot version from a jail.  Road Trips  V1:3 bonus disc.

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: Late period: why like it?  Because BW & JG imbue it with an energy befitting the rest of this great show.  Not the greatest version, but loads of fun.
69 Goodness - Rollin' like a Stingray....

performances.venue: University Auditorium, University of Arizona Tucson, AZ
performances.description: Incredibly rauchy at one point Pigpen is literrally growling into the mic, the ending is such an awesome freakout by Bobby and Pigpen and the band
Fantastic one! The band sounds like they're about to combust while Pig gets the audience amped up. Great on every level.
Buried under some sound quality issues is a 25 minute epic with massive jams and a dollar and quarter Pig rap for the ages.
Really solid early version, definitely worth a listen
Wickedly sick lovelight. St. Stephen and China Cat Teasers. This is a blow up the house barn burner finisher to an epic show.

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: Inspired 1990 version from one of the best shows post-brent.
Super swinging version, Pig and Lesh all over this
Dynamic. Not the best, perhaps, but a 25-minute version from DP16 that's definitely worth listing.
Relentless funky groove
Short version, but some great MIDI playing. You can hear how deeply influenced Garcia was by saxophonists.
This has it all. Pig on top, tight frantic lines, tension, build, and crowd back and forth. Serious sequence here starting with the High Time.
Wonderful bluesy psychedelic wonder, Pigpen controlling the proceedings, HOT version
Pig and the boys bringin' sinful jammin to the heartland - yes it 's very good.
Killer version with Clarence Clemons from Solstice show PPV
Shine on Me

performances.venue: McArthur Court, University of Oregon Eugene, OR
performances.description: Out of control!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Thunderous
One of Bob's best from epic show
This definately one of the best 90's versions.
Pig and Bobby drag this one out nicely!
How else to end a show like this?
Pig and the band crank it out with Bobby throwing crazy backup yodels and barks on this one ....
Great really fun Bobby love light. Jerry is just bubbling with energy during his solos and Bobby sings with an extra passion.
Do yourself a favor and listen to this lovelight, especially Pig’s rap
Shine on Me
Kick-ASS Lovelight. Man, this whole show is smokin'!
Lovelight > Caution jam > Lovelight. Booyah!!
Blazing start to an awe inspiring, historically massive show.  It's pure.  Pig and Bobby are especially fun during the hocket (vocal back and forth).
The last 35 min of this show are just beautiful. From NFA till the end it's just smooth sailing goddamned good times Grateful Dead. Enjoy.

performances.venue: Field House, U. of Cincinnati Cincinnati, OH
performances.description: NFA > Lovelight. Pigpen and Bobby trade ideas towards the end.
Nothing ends a set like some classic R&B.
37 minutes. Solid, 1969 version. Elvin Bishop and Wayne Ceballos singing. No pigpen, but very unique version. Worth a listen for sure.
Dark Star -> St. Stephen -> The Eleven -> Turn on your lovelight. 83 minutes of summer '69 awesomeness. Heady stuff going down here.
One of my personal favorite Bobby Lovelights
Pure '70 Dead. Like the HH before, this one grows steadily up to the full berserk, rather than exploding from go. Pig/Bobby outro is immortal.
Super hot Pigpen is almost beat boxing at one point has to be heard to be believed, tremendous, vocal jam by pig predating beatboxing vocaljams by yrs
30 minutes of primal Pigpen awesome show stopping performance, WOW
Sweet Pig Rap with MENTAL upfront and backend  jammin'

performances.venue: Family Dog at the Great Highway San Francisco, CA
performances.description: Nice 30+ minute version. Hot psychedelic blues
Spectacular, raw power mess here - Pig in control - RIGHT ON!

performances.venue: Moscone Convention Center San Francisco, CA
performances.description: Interesting one with Boz covering some of the vocal work.
Lovelight>NFA>GDTRFB>Lovelight ..yup
smokin version
With a Jerry riff here and Jerry riff there, everywhere a Jerry riff-riff. This intro has an Allman swing.

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: The Dave Murray "Love Light"! Also, James Cotton lays down the harp for an extra bluesy feel. Really spry, energetic version from a great show.
Love this version
lovelight out of space! split version
smokin
Nucking Futs way to end a show!  Pig invites the crowd up to help in the rap on his mic and say whatever they want!
NYE Lovelight with Tower of Power, the horns add a nice touch.
Pulsing and free. Bill sounds like he has triple the arms. Pig sweats some blues, Garcia liquifies. Lock yourself in, strap up, and don't look back.
Wait a minute!  Hard to figure how this one hasn't been posted yet. Very solid all 'round performance by all.
Phil's 29th birthday "Black and White Ball"
nice tight version
35 minuts of utter blues and psychedelic brilliance
Leave It on
Nice 25 minute excursion through a blues rock psychedelic stew, Fantastic early dead killer pigpen and Jerry leads throughout.
Lovelight Not Fade Away Lovelight Pigpen has all in raptured attention a wonderful classic
Pigpen really delivering for the folks down on haight. Fantastic rare primal early grateful dead
Truly an amazingly awesome version, with special guest David Crosby on guitar. A real true heady version with dead friend Crosby helping out the boys

performances.venue: Oakland-Alameda County Coliseum Arena Oakland, CA
performances.description: With Carlos Santana lending a helping hand to the proceedings on this evening. Great Chinese New Years
Absolutely wonderful obby lovelight complete with orgasmic falsetto rock star screaming, wish they divided these between bobby lovelights and pigpen l

performances.venue: University of Iowa Iowa City, IA
performances.description: Pig layin his rap on the midwest college crowd ha - pure '71 style here -the end duet of howls with Bobby is awesome.
Pig in control, mucho cowbell and JG does his fretboard gymnastics.

performances.venue: Academy of Music New York, NY
performances.description: Pig takes the wheel on a wild ride through the funk dimension. "I know you got it hid away someplace, 'cuz I've been there before."

performances.venue: Robertson Gym, U.C.S.B. Santa Barbara, CA
performances.description: House rockin' party in the basement

performances.venue: Oakland-Alameda County Coliseum Stadium Oakland, CA

performances.description: Downright TRIBAL! If this had better sound quality it would be considered one of the best of '69. Helluva ride, clocking in at 42 minutes. Spin it!

performances.venue: Student Union Ballroom, U. Utah Salt Lake City, UT
performances.description: Hot Action on the rideout
Great intro coming out of Throwing Stones.
Hot early lovelight.

performances.venue: Madison Sq Garden New York, NY
performances.description: “Wait a minute” -Bobby
Gritty, bluesy LL perfection!
Ludicrous speed version with Bobby on fire.
You know the drill by now; DS > SS > 11 > LL; gotta catch 'em all

performances.venue: Brendan Byrne Arena East Rutherford, NJ
performances.description: Genuinely super 80s version....

performances.venue: Alpine Valley Music Theatre East Troy, WI
performances.description: Glorious return of lovelight to regular rotation. Phil leads with the riff out of NFA. Can’t imagine what this was like
A rarity: No Pig or Bobby & no vocals. Still, beautifully inventive soloing shows why they kept it in rotation for so long. This "goof" is worth it.

performances.venue: NY State Pavilion, Flushing Meadow Park Queens, NY
performances.description: Goes way off the rails with Bobby, Pig, audience members and Phil all acting quite mad. Reminds me of some of the Acid Test recordings. A rarity.
An aural honeypot capping a dynamite show.
Doot-doot-doo, doot-doot-doo, doot-doot-doo, doot-dat-dee
Under the radar show, but blazing, blistering, and hard rocking Love Light. The whole set is outrageous.

performances.venue: Family Dog at the Great Highway San Francisco, CA
performances.description: Classic early 1970.. Alligator > drums > The Other One > Mason's Children > Caution Jam > Turn On Your Lovelight

performances.venue: Family Dog at the Great Highway San Francisco, CA
performances.description: The rap gets good and weird, and there's some funny doo-wop backup vocals around minute 17.

performances.venue: Shrine Exhibition Hall Los Angeles, CA
performances.description: Awesome 1968 version nice twist and turns, 1968 is a good year for love lights
this is great, even if only a small snippet, was rest of this show in the recent find?
Absolutely love the late 1960's love light's Awesome psychedelic blues HOT
Wow 20 minutes of bliss this show is interstellar.

performances.venue: Polo Field Golden Gate Park San Francisco, CA
performances.description: Half hour of pure bliss an amazing little nugget of a show, archive list slightly different from Dead Base
Another real heady excursion through lovelight in 1969
Wow another heady 1969 Lovelight amazing how they could bring the energy almost nightly back then.
Fantastic, Pigpen in control this evening

performances.venue: Fillmore East New York City, NY
performances.description: Close to a half hour of psychedelic blues brilliance very nice
Pig asks some couple to "do something nasty" and to come up on stage, then the band almost soulds like they're starting Purple Haze. Wild times.
Incomplete show, but a perfect artifact preserves the LL in all its sweaty greasy glory. Pig's on form, the band is in swampfunk mode. All good here.

performances.venue: Baton Rouge International Speedway Baton Rouge, LA
performances.description: Nice 25 minute romp of psychedelic blues with Pigpen triumphantly guiding the way, Fantastic like almost all 1969 Pigpen and dead in general
fantastic jamming lovelight with a hot juicy pigpen rap
25 Minutes of 1970 Pigpen magic.
Absolutely marvelous contains a heady brillant St. Stephen jam, this is pure audio gold.
With Huey Lewis on Harmonica.
The love lights always get ignored it seems. pure fire '70 dead
Bobby improving
The band is really into this one.
Brilliantly strange. T.C.'s organ adds stuttering weirdness to a churning groovathon.
This is a cool later-day version
Love the playing in earlier lovelights
Thundering with energy. Jerry torches the ending. Great show.
One of the best Bobby versions. They tear this one up. Bobby's possessed. Jerry's on.
This one goes to "cow bell".  Great end to a thoroughly wonderful show.

performances.venue: Cal Expo, Building A Sacramento, CA
performances.description: Whole band's got their macho up here....energy blasts off this recording
generous and beautiful. Devils field day.

performances.venue: Kiel Opera House St. Louis, MO
performances.description: Wonderful, highly underrated version that keeps the energy high all throughout. The jam after Pigs 'Box Back Nitties' line is killer

performances.venue: Aztec Bowl, San Diego State U. San Diego, CA
performances.description: With Members of Santana backing, incredible layers of percussion on top of a smokin' Lovlight.  Gotta hear it!

performances.venue: Fillmore East New York City, NY
performances.description: Absolute madness. Pigpen takes the Hammond for an extended stroll, and Jerry ends up on an acoustic before it's over.
Bob Star!
25 minutes of pigpen awesomeness

performances.venue: San Francisco Civic Aud. San Francisco, CA
performances.description: with Huey Lewis Bammies

performances.venue: Field House, Wesleyan University Middletown, CT
performances.description: Fantastic love light, wonderful vocals from both pigpen and bobby hot heavy jams hot split love light
Not quite as long as some but rather meaty

performances.venue: Henry J. Kaiser Center Oakland, CA
performances.description: A great Bobby Love Light on Valentines day. A wonderful Bobby version thanks to Brent dominating the keys and passionate vocals.
Pigpen gets a woman pregnant on stage. Rough AUD but utterly worth it. The jam starting around 16:00 is very hot.
Maybe you'll get a little pussy tonight. That pigpen!
Perhaps a little more jammed out than usual, great for a non-Pig version.
Not the best sound quality, but the quality shines through. Deserves a listing. Jerry and Bill K. on top form
Unusual and inventive jamming and Pig rapping, shame about the sound quality.
Rollicking good fun on NYE.

performances.venue: NY State Pavilion, Flushing Meadow Park Queens, NY
performances.description: The drummers are fired up on this one. Even T.Cs joining in on this energetic version. This gets an Allman Brothers flavor at times.
Bobby makes Pig proud with this version.  I bet Jerry took his eyes off the floor for this one.  Thanks to DEADOLOGY for this one (great read).
Strong night for the devils, nice end to an underrated set
Devastating, crushing...hard to believe it's not here yet in 2020
https://youtu.be/aJhnOq2q3ag yes indeed

performances.venue: Greek Theatre - University of California Berkeley, CA
Alpine Valley Music Theatre East Troy, WI

performances.description: You can tell the the band and the audience are having a blast. Also one of TC's last shows.
This one's got it!!! Great, as far as post-pigpen goes... Supported by diehard bobby energy and robustly happy mid 80's glide.
Flaccid effort to close a mammothly chill spring 94 show with 6 songs pre drums and a beefy first set. Quality texture searching throughout.

performances.venue: Family Dog at the Great Highway San Francisco, CA
Henry J. Kaiser Auditorium Oakland, CA
performances.description: Valentine's Day '88 - very fitting for them to close with Lovelight. They played Lovelight at every Valentines show. Great band interplay
Lovely little Love Light

performances.venue: San Jose state university  San jose,
performances.description: This is The Dead at peak performance level. Cataclysmic version. Everyone is ON. Explorative and not a beat missed. Easily top 5 of 69.
Its a Jerry-Phil-Brent steady groovin' stew w/excellent Bobby vocals
Bobby and Jerry crush this version
